answers.answer: Dear moto727,Thanks for posting your query.Sleep apnea per say cannot lead to diabetes. However diabetes can lead to sleep apnea, probably due to the obesity which is usually associated with diabetes.Hope that this information helps and hope that you will get better soon.Thank you for using MedHelp's "Ask an Expert" Service, where we feature some of world's renowned medical experts in their fields. Millions have benefitted from our service to get personalized advice for them and for their loved ones.Best Regards,Dr. Dinesh Goyal.

question: Can sleep apnea more likely than not cause diabetes?
title: Sleep Apnea/Diabetes
